Coconut Curry Noodle Soup 🤤🍜 Now that it’s officially Winter in Australia, noodle soups have been one of my favourite meals to make! This particular one is packed full of flavour, nourishing and so delicious. 👉 Swipe to see the ingredients I used in this dish, you can use any vegetables you like or even add in some mushrooms too, it’s really up to you! Enjoy 👌🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Serves: 3-4] 1 pack (450g) @ShareTheFantastic Fresh Thin Hokkien Noodles 1.5 tbsp cooking oil 3 cloves garlic, minced 1 thumb ginger, grated 2 stalks green onion, finely chopped (white + green parts separated) 3 tbsp Thai red curry paste (or sub for your fav curry paste) 4 cups (1L) vegetable stock 1 can (400mL) full-fat coconut milk 1 tbsp brown sugar 2 tbsp soy sauce, or to taste 1 tbsp lime juice 250g firm tofu, diced (tofu puffs also taste amazing in this recipe) Veggies of your choice, steamed or boiled (Eg. Carrot, bokchoy, broccolini…) Garnish ingredients: Lime wedge, bean sprouts, fresh coriander, fresh chilli, crushed roasted peanuts, fried shallots ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1. Prepare the hokkien noodles according to package instructions. Drain, rinse well with cold water then set aside. 2. In a large saucepan, heat the oil over medium-low heat. Add in the garlic, ginger, the white parts of the green onion and curry paste and fry for 2-3 minutes until fragrant. 3. Add in the vegetable stock and coconut milk and bring to the boil. Once boiling, add in the tofu, reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. 4. Stir through the brown sugar, soy sauce and lime juice and taste, adjusting the saltiness/sweetness to your preference. Simmer for a further 5 minutes. 5. Divide the noodles, tofu and veggies into bowls. Ladle on the hot broth, garnish and serve! 😍 #ShareTheFantastic #Collab #Ad

Hokkien Noodle Stir-fry 😍👌🏼 Here’s one of my favourite go-to meals since it’s so easy and quick to make! 👉 Swipe to see the ingredients I used in this dish. Remember it’s a super versatile recipe so you can use any vegetables you already have in your fridge! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Serves 3] 1 Pack (450g) @ShareTheFantastic Fresh Hokkien Noodles Sauce: 1 tbsp light soy sauce, 1 tbsp dark soy sauce, 1 tbsp maple syrup or coconut sugar, 1/4 tsp ground black pepper, 2 tbsp water, 1 tbsp cornstarch 1 small onion, thinly sliced (I used 1/2 a large one) 2 cloves garlic, finely chopped 1 thumb of ginger, finely chopped 1 carrot, peeled and thinly sliced 1 red capsicum, thinly sliced 100g fried tofu puffs, cut into bite sized pieces 1 bunch greens of your choice (I used a mix of broccolini, choy sum and bokchoy) Splash of sesame oil Garnish: Toasted sesame seeds, green onions, fresh chilli and chilli oil ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1. Prepare the hokkien noodles according to package instructions, drain, rinse well with cold water then set aside. 2. In the meantime, combine all of the sauce ingredients into a small bowl and whisk well. 3. Add a splash of cooking oil into a large wok or frypan over high heat. Add in the onion, garlic and ginger and fry for 1 minute until fragrant. Add in the carrot, capsicum and a few tbsp of water and fry for 2 minutes. 4. Add in the tofu puffs, greens, hokkien noodles and fry for 1 minute. Give the sauce another whisk before pouring it into the pan. Toss to coat all the ingredients and cook for another 1-2 minutes until glossy and thickened. 5. Turn off the heat then add in a splash of sesame oil. Divide into 3 bowls and garnish with sesame seeds, green onions, fresh chilli and chilli oil. Enjoy immediately! 🤤🥢🌶 #ShareTheFantastic #Collab

No-bake Blackberry Lemon Cheesecake 🍋💜 If you ever feel like making a fruity, creamy and delicious dessert, look no further 🤭 The flavour combinations are endless but I decided to use the blackberries that I had in the fridge for this one! Full recipe is below, enjoy 👌🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Base 1 cup almonds (any nuts work) 1/2 cup shredded coconut 1/4 tsp sea salt 1 cup pitted dates ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Filling 1.5 cups raw cashews, soaked overnight & drained (or, a little hack is to soak it in boiling water for 10-15 mins instead!) 1/2 cup full fat coconut cream 1/2 cup maple syrup 1/4 cup lemon juice Zest of 2 lemons 1 tsp vanilla extract 1/2 cup blackberries (if frozen, thaw first) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Method 1. Add the almonds, coconut and salt into a blender or food processor and blitz well until it becomes a fine crumb. Add in the dates and continue to process until well combined. It should stick when pressed together, if not then add in 1 tbsp of water and blend again. Press into a lined cake tin and pop into the freezer. 2. For the filling, combine all the ingredients minus the blackberries into a blender and blend until completely smooth. Take out a little over half of the mixture and pour on top of the base. Place into the freezer to set slightly. 3. With the remaining mixture, add in the blackberries and blend until smooth. Pour on top of the first layer and freeze until completely set. 4. Decorate with your desired toppings and serve. You can then place it into the fridge for up to 1 week or freeze it for 1 month (thaw before serving). Enjoy! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ I got all of the dried ingredients for this recipe from @thesourcebulkfoods! I’ll be showing you the herbs & spices that I get from their store in an upcoming post 🥰

Roast Red Pepper & Tomato Pasta 🍝🍅🌶 Rich, creamy and so flavourful, here’s a simple pasta recipe that you need to try 🤤 Swipe to see all of the ingredients I used, I already had every single ingredient in my pantry and fridge! 👌🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨[Serves: 4] 3 red capsicums/peppers, sliced in half lengthways and seeds discarded 5 medium tomatoes, halved (I used 4 medium + a handful of cherry tomatoes. You can also just use 2 punnets of cherry or grape tomatoes) 1 red onion, peeled & quartered 2 garlic cloves, peeled 1 tbsp extra virgin olive oil 500g @SanRemoPasta (I used their fettuccine, but you can use any pasta shape for this recipe!) Salt & freshly ground black pepper 3/4 cup vegetable stock 3/4 cup unsweetened almond milk Chilli flakes Fresh basil, to serve ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1. Preheat the oven to 220°C. On a lined baking tray, place the capsicums/peppers skin side up, tomatoes skin side down along with the onions and garlic. Drizzle on the olive oil to coat the ingredients and generously season with salt and freshly cracked black pepper. Roast for 25-30 minutes or until lightly golden and charred. 2. In the meantime bring a large pot of salted water to the boil and cook your pasta according to packet instructions. Once cooked, drain, add back into the pot and set aside. 3. Take the roast veg out of the oven and add into your blender along with the vegetable stock and unsweetened almond milk (add less liquid for a thicker sauce). Blend until just smooth then transfer into the pot. Over medium-high heat, toss to combine until pasta is coated evenly with the sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 4. Serve immediately with chilli flakes and fresh basil. Enjoy! 😍🍃 #SanRemoPasta #WeAreFamily #Collab

Sun-dried Tomato Pesto Pasta 🍅🍃 Feed the family with this flavour packed pesto pasta recipe that only requires a handful of ingredients! The best part is it’s so simple to make and can be whipped up within 20 minutes. Swipe across to see all of the ingredients needed for this recipe! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Serves: 4] - 500g @SanRemoPasta (I had a packet of orrechiette in my pantry so I used this. ANY shape pasta will work!) - 1 cup (150g) sun-dried tomatoes - 1 packed cup (30g) fresh basil (got this straight from my backyard!) - 1/4 cup cashews, almonds or pine nuts - 3 cloves of garlic, peeled - 1 tbsp nutritional yeast - 1/4 to 1/3 cup extra virgin olive oil (or you can use the reserved oil from the jar of sun-dried tomatoes) - Salt & pepper to taste ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1. Bring a large pot of salted water to the boil and cook your pasta according to packet instructions. Drain and set aside. 2. In the meantime, combine the sun-dried tomatoes, fresh basil, nuts of your choice, garlic and nutritional yeast into a food processor or blender. Process on low to roughly chop and break down the ingredients. 3. With the motor running, begin to slowly pour in the oil and process until you reach your desired consistency, depending on whether you prefer a smoother or chunkier pesto. 4. Mix all of the pesto with the pasta until well coated. Top with fresh basil and chilli flakes. Enjoy! 😍👌🏼 #SanRemoPasta #WeAreFamily #Collab

Simple Lentil Bolognese 🍝 This recipe is perfect for this period as it is not only easy to make, but is also affordable and nutritious too! 👌🏼 If you want to give it a go then I’ve popped the recipe below! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨[Serves: 2] 250g spaghetti (I used a pack of @SanRemoPasta Spaghetti Pulse Pasta that I dug up from my pantry. LOVE it because it’s super nutritious, 1 serve has 26.8g of protein!!) 1 tbsp olive oil 1 yellow onion, diced 2 garlic cloves, minced 1 large carrot, finely diced or grated 1 can lentils, drained & rinsed 1 jar (500g) your favourite pasta sauce 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes 1/2 cup water 1 tsp dried basil 1/2 tsp dried rosemary 1/2 tsp dried oregano 1/2 tsp red pepper flakes (optional) Salt & pepper, to taste Vegan parmesan, to serve Fresh basil, to serve ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1. Bring a pot of water to the boil. Add a generous pinch of salt and cook your pasta according to packet instructions. Drain and set aside. 2. In a pan heat the oil over medium heat. Add in the onion, garlic and carrot and fry for 5 minutes until softened. 3. Add in the lentils, pasta sauce and diced tomatoes. Pour the water into the can and jar to wash out any remaining bits and pour it into the pan. Stir through. 4. Add in the basil, rosemary, oregano, red pepper flakes (if using) and season with salt and pepper to taste. 5. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 20 minutes until sauce has thickened. Taste and season if required. 6. When ready to serve, mix half of the sauce with the pasta, then top with the remaining sauce on top. Garnish with fresh basil and vegan parmesan (store-bought or I have a simple recipe in my cookbook!) and you’re done! 🍃 Healthy, simple to make, delicious and nutritious! Enjoy 🤤 #SanRemoPasta #SanRemoPartner

BLUEBERRY PANCAKES 🥞💙🤤 I think these have got to be one of my favourite pancakes to make... I mean, bursts of sweet warm blueberries in every bite?! YES PLEASE 😍 It’s also gluten-free, refined sugar-free and oil-free, woohoo!! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Makes 2 servings] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ▫️1 cup + 2 tbsp plant-based milk (any will do but I think almond or soy tend to work the best!) ▫️1 ripe banana, mashed ▫️2 tsp lemon juice ▫️1 tsp lemon zest ▫️1 tsp vanilla extract ▫️1 cup buckwheat flour (this is my favourite gluten-free flour from @thesourcebulkfoods. You can however sub it for plain flour or even plain wholemeal flour!) ▫️2 tsp baking powder ▫️1/2 tsp ground cinnamon ▫️1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries (during this period frozen is your best bet! Way cheaper & lasts much longer) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a bowl, combine the almond milk, banana, lemon juice, lemon zest & vanilla extract. Mix until well combined. 2️⃣ Add in the buckwheat flour, baking powder and cinnamon and whisk until smooth. Gently fold through the blueberries (if using frozen do not thaw). 3️⃣ Cook on a non-stick frypan on medium heat for 2-3 minutes per side or until golden. 4️⃣ I served mine with dollop of @purecocobella coconut yogurt, maple syrup and more blueberries 👌🏼

Noodles all day everyday 😍🤤 Was craving a noodle stir-fry so I decided to whip this up! Only took me about 15 minutes too 👌🏼This is one of those recipes where I don’t measure anything but I’ve left the basic recipe below! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ To prepare your hokkien noodles, bring a saucepan of water to the boil, add your noodles in and after a minute gently separate the strands. You’re not trying to cook the noodles so they will still have quite a bit of a bite to them. Drain and set aside. 2️⃣ Fry up your choice of protein until golden and crispy and set aside. For this dish I decided to use a vegan meat that I bought from the Asian grocers. 3️⃣ Heat up your wok or frypan onto high heat and add a splash of oil. Fry up any veggies you like (I kept it simple and only used gailan & broccolini) for 2-3 minutes until semi cooked. 4️⃣Add in your noodles and protein and season with your favourite sauces. I usually use dark soy sauce (for colour), light soy sauce, sweetener (eg. coconut sugar), pepper and sometimes vegan oyster sauce. 5️⃣ Toss around until everything is well coated and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes until veggies and noodles are fully cooked through. If the pan dries up then add a splash of water and continue frying. 6️⃣ At the very end add in a handful of green onions and drizzle with toasted sesame oil. Turn off the heat and serve. I topped mine with more green onion and sesame seeds! Fresh chilli would have been good too 🌶 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Everytime I make these dishes it tastes waaay better than take out! Less greasy, I can adjust the flavour and saltiness to my own liking and use my favourite ingredients. Would highly recommend you give this a go. Enjoy 🌱 #ThrivingOnPlants

MACADAMIA, LEMON & COCONUT CHEESECAKE 💛✨ This no-bake recipe is gluten-free, refined sugar-free and so easy to make! I used @ausmacadamias for the filling which made it sooo rich and creamy 🤤 The full recipe is below so make sure you try it out! (Hint: Valentine’s Day is just around the corner if ya wanna impress someone special 😉🤭) ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉 Base 1 cup macadamias 1.5 cups shredded coconut 12 Medjool dates, pitted 1/4 tsp sea salt 2 tbsp water ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉 Filling 3 cups @ausmacadamias, soaked in water overnight & drained (or for the quick option, soak in boiling water for 10-15 mins before draining) 1/2 cup canned coconut cream 1/4 cup coconut oil, melted 1 tsp pure vanilla extract 3/4 cup maple syrup 1/4 cup lemon juice Zest of 2 lemons 1/8 tsp sea salt 1/4 cup macadamia milk, to blend ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a food processor or blender, combine the base ingredients and blitz until mixture is well combined and sticks when pressed between your fingers. Pour into a lined springform cake pan and press the mixture evenly along the bottom of the pan. Place in the freezer. 2️⃣ In the meantime, combine all the filling ingredients and blend until smooth and creamy. If necessary, add more milk to help the mixture blend. Pour mixture on top of the of the chilled base and return to the freezer. Freeze overnight until completely set. 3️⃣ When ready to decorate, remove the cheesecake from the pan. I decorated mine with more macadamias, melted caramel chocolate, cookie crumbs, toasted coconut flakes and lemon zest! Allow to sit at room temperature for 10-15 minutes before serving. Enjoy 👌🏼 #ausmacadamias

LEMON POPPYSEED PANCAKES 🥞🍋✨ If you haven’t tried out this recipe yet then do yourself a favour & whip up a batch for your next breakfast! Here’s the recipe: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a bowl combine 1 cup plant-based milk, 2 tbsp lemon juice, the zest of 1 small lemon, 1 tbsp maple syrup and 1 tsp vanilla extract. 2️⃣ Add in 1 cup buckwheat flour, 2 tsp baking powder and 1 tbsp poppyseeds. Mix well (FYI I get all of my dry ingredients from @thesourcebulkfoods ♻️). 3️⃣ Pour 1/4 cup batter into a frypan to form each pancake and cook on medium heat until golden on both sides. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉 This stack goes perfect with @purecocobella vanilla coconut yogurt & fresh blueberries 🤤🥥💙 ENJOY!!

✨VANILLA OVERNIGHT OATS✨ Here’s a super simple overnight oats recipe that you can whip up in minutes and have ready to go the next morning! The best part is you can easily customise it to your own liking in terms of both flavour and texture 🙌🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🥣 FULL RECIPE [Serves: 1 Prep: 10 mins] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ▫️1/2 cup rolled oats ▫️2 tsp chia seeds (I stock up on both organic rolled oats + chia seeds every month at @thesourcebulkfoods ♻️) ▫️1 cup unsweetened almond milk (OR sub 1/4 cup of the milk for vegan yogurt instead to make it creamier. I just prefer to add mine on top to mix in later) ▫️2 tbsp @tropeaka Vanilla Lean Protein ▫️1/2 tsp vanilla extract ▫️Optional: 1-2 tsp maple syrup (sweeten to taste). Also feel free to add any additional ingredients you like eg. 1 heaped tbsp peanut butter. 🥜👅 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a glass jar or container, combine all of the above ingredients and mix well. 2️⃣ Pop the lid on and place into the fridge to thicken overnight or for at least 2-3 hours. 3️⃣ When ready to eat, give it a stir and enjoy with your fav toppings! I served mine with berries, @purecocobella coconut yogurt, roasted almonds, hemp seeds, cinnamon and an extra splash of almond milk! 🥛🥥🍓

Couscous & Lentil Stuffed Eggplant! 😍 Served with an easy lemon tahini sauce 🍋🥣 It’s hearty, packed full of flavour and such a delicious way to incorporate couscous into your meal. Give it a go for your next dinner: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Serves: 4 Time: 50 mins ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Slice 2 eggplants lengthways. Use a spoon to scoop out the flesh while making sure you still leave enough eggplant around the edges. Drizzle the eggplant with olive oil, season with salt + pepper and bake in a 200*C preheated oven for 25 minutes or until golden and cooked through. With the remaining eggplant, dice it and set aside. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 2️⃣ In the meantime, cook 1 cup of @SanRemoPasta wholemeal couscous according to package instructions. It’s high in fibre, a good source of protein, 98% fat-free and the best part is it cooks in just 6 minutes! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 3️⃣ To make the sauce, simply whisk together 3 tbsp tahini, garlic, 1 tbsp lemon juice, zest of 1/2 lemon, 1 minced garlic clove, 1 tsp maple syrup, salt + pepper to taste and water until smooth. Adjust the amount of water according to how thick/runny you want your sauce to be. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 4️⃣ Heat a frypan on medium heat and add in 1 tbsp of olive oil. Fry 1 diced onion and 2 cloves minced garlic for 2 minutes then add in the diced eggplant and 1 punnet of halved cherry tomatoes and cook for 3-4 minutes until slightly softened. Add in 1 can of rinsed & drained lentils, 1 tsp dried oregano and 1 tsp smoked paprika and cook for 1 minute. Season with salt + pepper to taste. Stir through the couscous, the juice of 1 small lemon and a handful of chopped fresh basil. 🍃 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 5️⃣ To serve, spoon the mixture into the eggplant shells, top with more fresh basil and drizzle on the lemon tahini sauce. Enjoy!👌🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ @SanRemoPasta #SanRemoCouscous #SanRemoPasta #Collab

✨GOLDEN OATS✨ Ever thought of adding turmeric to your sweet breakfasts? Well here’s the perfect way to do it! This recipe is satisfying, wholesome and bound to keep you full of energy all morning. Give it a go: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 🥣 FULL RECIPE [Serves 1-2, Time: 10 mins] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a small saucepan, combine 1 cup quick oats, 1 cup @SoGoodAu Prebiotic Soy Milk, 1 cup water, 1/2 heaped tsp ground turmeric, a pinch of black pepper, 1/2 tsp ground cinnamon and 1/2 tbsp each of hemp, ground flax & chia seeds. Optional but I also added in 1 scoop of plant-based vanilla protein! 2️⃣ Cook over medium heat and stir until thickened to your desired consistency. 3️⃣ Transfer into a bowl, top with fresh fruit and sweeten to taste with maple syrup. Enjoy! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Let me know if you try out this recipe, I’d love to know what you think! 😄🌱 #SoGoodAu #MakeTodaySoGood #Collab

Double Choc Pancakes 🍫🥞 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Christmas is just around the corner so here I am with some Christmas themed recipes! 🥳 This epic stack is gluten-free, oil-free and refined sugar-free (depending on the choc chips you use), yet so damn delicious!! Whisk well. 2️⃣ Add in 3/4 cup buckwheat flour (I get mine from @thesourcebulkfoods), 1/4 cup cocoa powder, 2 tsp baking powder and a pinch of salt. Mix until smooth. Fold in a huge handful of vegan choc chips (or you can roughly chop up some dark chocolate to add in). 3️⃣ Lightly grease your frypan and cook on each side for 2-3 minutes over medium heat. 4️⃣ Transfer to a plate and decorate with your fav toppings! LEMON BLUEBERRY CHEESECAKES 🍋😍🤤 Who wants one?! 🙋🏻‍♀️ Tangy, creamy and oh so delicious, these cheesecakes are also gluten-free, oil-free and refined sugar-free! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Makes 6] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a food processor combine 1 cup sultanas (or sub for pitted dates), 1/2 cup @thesourcebulkfoods shredded coconut, 1/2 cup walnuts, 1 tsp lemon zest and 1/8 tsp sea salt. Blitz together then press into the bottom of 6 muffin moulds (I use silicone ones). Place in the freezer. 2️⃣ In the meantime, blend 1 cup raw cashews (soaked & drained), 1/2 cup coconut cream, 1/4 cup lemon juice, zest of 1 lemon, 1/2 cup maple syrup and 1 tsp vanilla extract until smooth. Pour out half the mixture and whisk in 1/2 tsp ground turmeric (for colour), then spoon and fill up 2/3 of the moulds. Pop into the freezer. 3️⃣ Add 1/2 cup frozen thawed blueberries to the remaining mixture and blend until smooth. Spoon on top of yellow layer and return to the freezer to set overnight. 4️⃣ Once set, decorate and leave to thaw at room temp for 10-15 mins before serving. 👌🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ As always remember to tag me @user_2 if you make any of my recipes! Would LOVE to see your creations 🌱 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀

Roast Pumpkin & Couscous Salad! 😍 This recipe is SO simple to make and perfect to enjoy with friends and family over the festive season! 👌🏼 Try it out: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Serves: 6] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Preheat the oven to 200°C conventional or 180°C fan forced. To a large bowl add 750g diced pumpkin, 1 red onion (cut into wedges), 1 can chickpeas (drained & rinsed), 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp smoked paprika, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp mixed herbs & salt + pepper. Spread evenly onto a lined baking tray and bake until pumpkin is golden and cooked through. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 2️⃣ In a small saucepan bring 1 cup veggie stock to the boil, turn off the heat then add in 1 cup @SanRemoPasta couscous. Pop the lid on and allow to stand for 5 minutes. Remove lid and fluff up with a fork to separate the grains. Set aside to cool (I love that it only takes 5 minutes to cook! So quick and convenient). ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 3️⃣ To assemble, combine the pumpkin + onion + chickpeas, couscous, 1 packed cup of rocket, 1 small bunch of mint (roughly chopped), juice of 1 lemon and a top with a handful of pine nuts. Season with salt & pepper to taste if desired. Serve! 🍽🌿 #SanRemoCouscous #SanRemoPasta #EasyEasy

BERRY COCONUT CHEESECAKES 😍✨ These babies are no bake, GF, oil-free, refined sugar-free and damn delicious!! As always, they’re also super simple to make 👌🏼 Full recipe is down below, enjoy! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉 FULL RECIPE Makes: 6-12 (depending on the size of your moulds) Time: 20 minutes + setting time ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a blender, combine 1 heaped cup of @thesourcebulkfoods raw cashews (soaked overnight & drained), 1/2 cup canned coconut cream, 1/4 cup @purecocobella vanilla coconut yogurt, 1/4 cup lemon juice, zest of 1 lemon, 1/2 cup maple syrup and 1 tsp vanilla extract. 2️⃣ Blend until smooth and pour into the bottom half of cupcake/muffin moulds (I use silicone ones so it’s completely non-stick). Place into the freezer. 3️⃣ In the meantime, add in 1/2 cup frozen blueberries and 1/2 cup frozen blackberries into the remaining mixture and blend until smooth. Once the other layer has set slightly, pour berry layer on top and return to the freezer to set completely. 4️⃣ Once set, decorate with your favourite toppings and enjoy! 😌🙌🏼 If taking them straight out of the freezer, allow to thaw at room temperature for 10-15 minutes before serving. 💜

Banana Cinnamon Pancakes! 🍌🥞 Fluffy, delicious & super simple to make! Believe it or not, this stack is also gluten-free, refined sugar-free & oil-free! 😳 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Serves 2] 1️⃣ In a bowl mash 1 ripe banana. Pour in 1 cup plant-based milk, 1 tsp vanilla extract and 1 tsp apple cider vinegar and whisk together. 2️⃣ In the same bowl, add in 1 cup buckwheat flour, 2 tsp baking powder, 1.5 tsp ground cinnamon and a pinch of sea salt. Mix well until you have a smooth batter. 3️⃣ Cook on a non-stick frypan on medium heat for 2-3 mins per side or until golden. 4️⃣ Serve immediately with your favourite toppings! I used bananas, blueberries, @thesourcebulkfoods hemp seeds, @purecocobella vanilla coyo and maple syrup 💦🥥 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉 Served these pancakes on my beautiful new @ecologyhomewares from @house.online... 🍽

Spiced Banana Berry Nut Loaf 🤭🍌🍓 This loaf truly has it all - it’s naturally sweetened using bananas & dates, has the perfect hint of spice and berries in every bite! This loaf is also gluten-free and oil-free... It’s truly too good to be true! 👌🏼 Try it out for yourself: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ FULL RECIPE ✨ [Makes: 8-10 slices] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Preheat the oven to 180*C. In a bowl combine 1 3/4 cup buckwheat flour, 3/4 cup blanched almond meal, 1 tsp baking powder, ½ tsp baking soda, 1½ tsp ground cinnamon, 1 tsp ground ginger, ½ tsp ground nutmeg, ¼ tsp ground cardamom and ¼ tsp sea salt (I get all my dried goodies from @thesourcebulkfoods ♻️) 2️⃣ In the meantime, combine 12 pitted + soaked + drained Medjool dates, 3 ripe bananas, 1 1/4 cup almond milk, 2 tsp vanilla extract and 2 tsp apple cider vinegar. Blend well. 3️⃣ Pour into the bowl with the dry mix and mis well until you end up with a smooth batter. 4️⃣ Add in 1 heaped cup mixed nuts/seeds (chopped) and 1 heaped cup frozen berries. Transfer to a lined loaf pan and bake for 55 mins or until cooked through. 5️⃣ Cool completely at room temp before slicing. Store in an air-tight container at room temperature for 2-3 days or in the fridge for up to 1 week. You can also freeze them and reheat in the toaster as needed! Enjoy. ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉 For more epic recipes click the link in my bio to check out my 75+ recipe cookbook! 💚🌱

GOLDEN OATS 😍💛✨ Earlier this year I discovered my new fav way to make oats by simply adding in turmeric and a bunch of other spices! 🥣 Not only is it great for you, but it’s simply delicious… especially when paired with sweet fruit! 🍌This recipe is in my cookbook but I’ll be sharing it with you all today so you can can give it a try yourself, enjoy: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 👉 FULL RECIPE [Serves: 2 ⠀Time: 15 min] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a saucepan combine 1 cup quick oats, 1 cup unsweetened almond milk (or your fav plant-based milk), 1 cup water, 2 tsp chia seeds, 2 tsp ground flaxseed meal, 2 tsp hemp seeds, 1 tsp turmeric, a pinch fo black pepper, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp ginger and 1/4 tsp nutmeg. 2️⃣ Cook on medium heat and stir until it thickens to your desired consistency. Turn off the heat and add in a dash of maple syrup to sweeten the oats. 3️⃣ Divide into two bowls and top with fresh fruit, nuts and a dollop of home-made raspberry chia jam if desired (recipe is also in my book) 👌🏼 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Click the link in my bio to grab a copy of my cookbook! Or for my Aus & Nz audience, simply find a copy at your local bookstores 🌱📗 #ThrivingonplantsCookbook

RASPBERRY LEMON MUFFINS 😍🍋💖 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ So your girl really delivered with this recipe… They’re moist, fluffy and the perfect balance of sweet and tart! I’m telling you, you’re not going to believe how damn good the texture and taste is! 👌🏼 Plus, they are gluten-free, oil-free and refined sugar-free 😱 You need to try this asap if you’re after a healthy yet delicious muffin recipe!! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Makes 9-12] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Preheat your oven to 180°C (conventional and not fan forced!). In a small bowl combine ⅓ cup lemon juice, zest of 2 lemons, ⅔ cup maple syrup (or your fav liquid sweetener. Rice malt syrup will make it less sweet if that’s what you prefer!), ⅔ cup almond milk and 1 tsp vanilla extract. Whisk well. 2️⃣ In a large bowl, whisk together 1⅔ buckwheat flour, ⅔ cup blanched almond meal, 2 tsp baking powder, 1 tsp baking soda and 1/4 tsp sea salt. 3️⃣ Pour the wet ingredients into the dry mix and mix until you end up with a smooth batter. Gently fold through 1 heaped cup of frozen raspberries. 4️⃣ Spoon into muffin trays (I love using silicone moulds as they are non-stick!) and bake for 25 minutes or until golden and cooked through. 5️⃣ Transfer to a cooling rack before decorating. I added on a dollop of @PureCocobella vanilla coconut yogurt, more raspberries and lemon zest! 🤤🥥 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ P.S. I feel as though people get super intimidated by baking itself let alone GF baking, but I promise it is super easy with some practice and trial and error! For example I’ve found that using a combination of @thesourcebulkfoods organic buckwheat flour & blanched almond meal delivers the best results (you honestly won’t be able to tell it’s not wheat flour!!). Happy baking and I hope you love this recipe as much as I do! 🤭

Cashew Banana Bread Loaf 😍🍌 This delicious banana bread loaf is gluten-free, oil-free and best of all, naturally sweetened using only bananas and dates! 😱🤭 Sounds too good to be true right? Well I guess you’ll have to try it out for yourself to see: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Makes 8-10 slices] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Preheat your oven to 180°C/350°F. Grease and line a loaf pan and set aside. 2️⃣ In a blender, combine 1¼ cups @SoGoodAu unsweetened cashew milk, 3 ripe bananas, 12 pitted & soaked Medjool dates, 2 tsp vanilla extract and 2 tsp apple cider vinegar. Blend until smooth. 3️⃣ In a large mixing bowl, mix together 1¾ cups buckwheat flour, ¾ cup blanched almond meal, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp cinnamon and ½ tsp sea salt. 4️⃣ Pour the wet mixture into the dry and mix until well combined. Pour into the prepared loaf pan. Sprinkle on ¼ cup chopped cashews. Bake in the oven for 55-60 minutes or until cooked through. 5️⃣ Allow loaf to cool completely on a cooling rack before slicing.  Despite there being no additional sweetener aside from the bananas and dates, this loaf is still perfectly sweet! 👌🏼Plus I love the added crunch from the cashews for some extra texture. Enjoy! 💛 #SoGood #Collab #CashewMilk #MakeTodaySoGood

Home made nourish bowls are my favourite kind of meals to put together! 😍 Here’s one that I made yesterday and it was hands down the most flavourful and delicious meal ever!!! Peel and dice 2 potatoes and coat with olive oil, mixed herbs, paprika, onion powder, garlic powder & salt + pepper. Evenly spread out onto a lined baking tray. 2️⃣ Cut up half a cauliflower into florets and coat in olive oil, paprika, cumin, onion powder, garlic powder, curry powder & salt + pepper. Add to tray. 3️⃣ Cut 1/4 small pumpkin into thick slices and coat with a mixture of sesame oil mixed with miso paste. Add to the tray and pop everything into the oven. 4️⃣ At the 30 minute mark or when the cauliflower is golden, take it out. Allow the pumpkin & potatoes to cook for 50-55 mins total or until golden. 5️⃣ While they are baking, prep any other veg of your choice! I blanched some broccolini, fried up corn + black beans and cut up a cucumber & avocado. 6️⃣ When ready, assemble your bowl by placing a handful of greens (eg. rocket/arugula) in, followed by all your remaining ingredients. I served mine with a balsamic reduction and bam!!! Best lunch ever 🤤 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨ P.S. I get all of my amazing herbs & spices from @thesourcebulkfoods 👌🏼 It makes all the difference when cooking and their range is endless!! Sundried Tomato & Basil Ravioli with Home-made Pesto 🤤🍅🍃 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ @SanRemoPasta has just launched their NEW fresh vegan ravioli range!! There are 3 flavours which include Roast Capsicum & Olive, Spinach & Garlic and Sundried Tomato, Basil & Lentil (my fav) 👌🏼 I paired mine with a home-made pesto, try it out for yourself: ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨PESTO RECIPE✨ ▫️1 packed cups fresh basil ▫️1 packed cup fresh spinach + rocket/arugula ▫️½ cup raw cashews, blanched almonds or walnuts ▫️¼ cup hemp seeds ▫️¼ cup nutritional yeast ▫️2 garlic cloves ▫️¼ tsp sea salt (or to taste) ▫️⅛ tsp black pepper ▫️¼ cup extra virgin olive oil ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a food processor, add in the fresh basil, spinach, rocket/arugula, cashews, hemp seeds, nutritional yeast, garlic plus 1-2 tbsp water to help blend it up. Process until all the ingredients are finely chopped. 2️⃣ With the motor still running, gradually pour in the olive oil. Check the texture of the pesto and blend in 1 tbsp of water at a time until you end up with the consistency you desire. Taste and season with salt and pepper. 3️⃣ To serve, cook 1 packet of @SanRemoPasta sundried tomato & basil ravioli according to packet instructions. Add in the pesto and generously coat the ravioli. LEMON BLUEBERRY POPPYSEED LOAF 😍🍋🍞 Moist & fruity with bursts of warm blueberries in every bite... What more could you want? The best part is it’s gluten-free, oil-free & refined sugar-free yet you won’t be able to tell! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Makes 8 slices] ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Preheat the oven to 180°C/356°F. Grease and line a loaf pan and set aside. 2️⃣ In a bowl, combine ¼ cup @purecocobella coconut yogurt, ⅔ cup rice malt syrup (sub with maple syrup for a sweeter option), 1 mashed banana, ¼ cup lemon juice, zest of 1 lemon, 1 tsp vanilla extract and ¾ cup almond milk. Whisk well. 3️⃣ In a separate bowl, whisk together 1¼ cups @thesourcebulkfoods buckwheat flour (It’s so good for GF baking!), ¼ cup @tropeaka vanilla lean protein, ½ cup blanched almond meal, 2 tsp baking powder, 1½ tbsp poppy seeds and ⅛ tsp sea salt. 4️⃣ Add the wet into the dry mix and mix until smooth. Gently fold through 1½ cups of fresh or frozen blueberries (coat in flour if using frozen to prevent it from colouring the batter). 5️⃣ Bake in the oven for 50-55 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from loaf pan and place on cooling rack for 30 min before slicing. Slice into 8 pieces and store in an airtight container. Enjoy! ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Make sure you tag me @user_2 if you make any of my recipes!! I love seeing all of your creations 🤩🌱 As usual comment down below if you have any recipe suggestions... 👇👇

ORANGE SULTANA CHEESECAKE SLICE 😍✨ Gluten-free, refined sugar-free, sweet, tangy and oh so creamy, this orange sultana cheesecake slice is a must try!! Did you know Aussie growers have been drying grapes since the 1890s?! Dried grapes are not only delicious but also high in dietary fibre and a rich source of vitamins and antioxidants! Give this recipe a go if you’re after a treat filled with sweet natural goodness 🤭 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ ✨FULL RECIPE✨ [Makes 9 slices] 👉 BASE ▫️1 cup Australian Sultanas ▫️3/4 cup walnuts ▫️3/4 cup shredded coconut ▫️1 tsp orange zest ▫️1/8 tsp sea salt 👉 FILLING ▫️2 cups raw cashews, soaked & drained ▫️1/2 cup canned coconut cream ▫️1/2 cup freshly squeezed orange juice ▫️Zest of 1 whole orange ▫️1/4 cup fresh lemon juice ▫️1/2 cup rice malt syrup (or sub for maple syrup for a sweeter option) ▫️1/4 cup melted coconut oil ▫️1 tsp vanilla extract ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ In a processor, combine all the base ingredients and blitz until you reach a crumbly and sticky mixture. Press into a lined square baking tin and chill in the freezer. 2️⃣ Blend all the filling ingredients until smooth and creamy and pour on top of the base. Sprinkle on Australian sultanas, orange zest and toasted coconut flakes. Freeze overnight. 3️⃣ Remove from the freezer and slice into 9 pieces. Decorate with extra toppings if desired. Thaw at room temperature for 10-15 minutes before serving. Enjoy👌🏼 @AustralianSultanas #AustralianDriedGrapes #AHandfulOfAustralianSunshine

Choc Coffee Cheesecake 😍🍫☕️ ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ Creamy, rich and decadent, this recipe is too damn good to not share with you all!! 🤤 I personally don’t drink coffee but love coffee flavoured desserts like this... Try it out for yourself!! 🤭🤭 ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ 1️⃣ Blend 1 cup @thesourcebulkfoods raw cashews (soaked overnight & drained), 1/4 cup canned coconut cream, 1/4 cup @purecocobella vanilla coconut yogurt, 1 tbsp lemon juice, 1/2 cup agave (or maple) and 1 tsp vanilla extract until smooth. 2️⃣ Pour into 6 silicone cupcake moulds, filling them up 1/3 of the way. Place in freezer until slightly set. In the meantime, add 2 tsp ground coffee into the remaining mix and blend. Pour onto vanilla layer until 2/3 of the way full. Return to freezer. 3️⃣For the last layer, add in 1/2 tbsp cocoa powder and blend. Pour on top of coffee layer to fill moulds completely. CHOC HAZELNUT CHEESECAKE 😍🍫🌰🍫✨ You all know how much I LOVE making no bake vegan cheesecakes & this recent flavour combo I made is sooo bomb 🤤🔥 These babies also happen to be gluten-free, oil-free & refined sugar-free too 😱 . 👉 HERE’S THE RECIPE: 1️⃣ Blend up ¾ cup soaked raw cashews, ¾ cup soaked raw hazelnuts (with no skin), ½ cup maple syrup, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1/8 tsp salt, ¼ cup @purecocobella vanilla coconut yogurt, ¼ cup canned coconut cream & 1 cup warm coconut milk until smooth & creamy 💦 2️⃣ Pour half the filling out into a bowl, then add 2 tbsp cocoa powder to the remaining batch & blend until smooth. 3️⃣ Evenly pour the chocolate filling into the bottom halves of 6 silicone moulds & pop into the freezer to set before pouring on the vanilla layer. Freeze overnight. 4️⃣ Decorate with your favourite toppings! In a bowl whisk together 1.5 cups @thesourcebulkfoods buckwheat flour, 1/4 cup coconut sugar, 1/2 tsp cinnamon, 1 tsp baking powder, 1/2 tsp baking soda & 1 tsp @tropeaka maca (Maca has so many healthy benefits! It has a nutty/earthy taste to it which goes well here. Gently fold through 1/2 heaped cup chopped walnuts into the batter. 4️⃣ Transfer to muffin bar moulds (so good since they’re already portioned!) for 20 minutes until risen, golden & cooked through. Raspberry Vanilla Protein Bread 🤭🍞💞 Gluten-free, refined sugar-free & you bet it’s damn delicious 😍👌🏼 I lightly toasted my slice then generously smeared on some @purecocobella vanilla coconut yogurt & it was the best combo ever 🤤🥥 . ✨HERE’S THE RECIPE:✨ 1️⃣ Preheat oven to 180°C/350°F. In a bowl combine 1 cup room temp almond milk, ½ cup agave or maple syrup, ¼ cup melted coconut oil, 2 tbsp lemon juice & the zest of 1 lemon. 2️⃣ In a separate large bowl, combine 1¾ cups @thesourcebulkfoods buckwheat flour (or sub for flour of your choice), ¼ cup vanilla protein (I use @tropeaka lean protein), ½ tsp cinnamon, 3 tsp baking powder & ⅛ tsp salt. 3️⃣ Pour wet mix in and whisk until smooth. 4️⃣ Add 1 heaping cup frozen raspberries into a small bowl & coat with 1 tbsp flour to prevent it from bleeding into the batter. Gently fold through batter. 5️⃣ Transfer into a loaf pan, top with shredded coconut & bake for 55-60 mins until golden and cooked through. Cool before slicing & enjoy! Mango & blueberry cheesecake bites 😍🙌🏼 With a date macadamia base & lemon myrtile in the two layers for an extra kick🍋👏🏼 . I’ve teamed up with @vitamix_aunz to create this amazing recipe using @aussiemangoes in their new A3500i Ascent Series blender 💦🌀 . ✨ Here’s the recipe✨ ▪️Base: 3/4 cup macadamia, 1/2 cup shredded coconut, 1 tbsp cashew butter, 1 cup pitted Medjool dates, 1/4 tsp salt → Blitz in blender on low speed, press into moulds & pop in the freezer ▪️Cheesecake Layer: 1 cup soaked raw cashews, 1/2 cup chilled coconut cream, 1/2 cup maple syrup, 1 tbsp ground lemon myrtile leaf, 1/4 cup lemon juice, zest of 1 lemon → Blend & take half of the mixture out. Add in 1/2 cup fresh @aussiemangoes + dash of turmeric > blend until smooth, pour into moulds & freeze until set. Blend 1/2 cup thawed frozen blueberries into the remaining mixture, pour onto mango layer & return to freezer until set! ▪️Topping: Decorate with fresh blueberries, lemon zest & any other ingredients of your choice! Enjoy 😘🌟🍰 #vitamix #vitamixrecipes #vitamixaunz #vitamixbestlife

Baked sweet potatoes 😍🍠✨ I always get questions about how I "bake" my potato fries and so here it is: ✅ Wash & peel your potatoes, then make sure you thoroughly dry them with a clean cloth/paper towel ✅ Add a drizzle of oil if desired, I find that only sweet potatoes may need some because they don't crisp up as easily as regular potatoes ✅ Add in a few tsp of your favourite herbs/spices! I love adding in mixed herbs, garlic powder, onion powder & smoked paprika to mine ✅ My secret is that I pop it into my AIRFRYER for 45-50 minutes at 180*C until golden & crispy! An airfryer essentially "fries" your food minus the oil + with little mess & effort! I'd say it's definitely worth investing in one 👌🏼 If you don't have one then simply place on a baking tray lined with non-stick baking paper & make sure they're separate/not touching each other too much. Bake on one side for 25 mins at 180*C, flip & bake for another 20 mins! ✨ ✅ I always serve mine with a good heaping of greens & a dollop of guac or sour cream + @thesourcebulkfoods hemp seeds for a dose of good fats 😙 ❇️ Enjoy!! It's really simple and just takes a little bit of patience 🤓 While they're baking it gives you time to make your salad + prep other things anyway so it works out great in my opinion 😎✌🏼 #vegan #potatoarelife #iliveandbreathepotatoes
